cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 mi SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf, forecast to turn northwest and then north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Cameron–Lake Charles, LA area (upper Texas / SW Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, including Lake Borgne, Pontchartrain and Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast eastward across southwest and south-central Louisiana, including the Mississippi Delta coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible, with a 25 % cumulative chance of ≥34 kt and low (<3 %) chance of ≥50 kt; strongest winds expected late Wednesday night through Thursday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–6 ft above ground level possible in the Mississippi Delta region, including Plaquemines Parish, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents; possible river flooding along lower Mississippi and disruption to navigation channels due to debris and high water.
